trans-unit.source: How to: Create My First Claims-Aware ASP.NET Service Using ACS
trans-unit.target: How to: Create My First Claims-Aware ASP.NET Service Using ACS

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: How to: Create My First Claims-Aware ASP.NET Service Using ACS
trans-unit.target: How to: Create My First Claims-Aware ASP.NET Service Using ACS

trans-unit.source: Applies To
trans-unit.target: Applies To

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This topic pertains to a legacy technology.
trans-unit.target: This topic pertains to a legacy technology.

trans-unit.source: To create XML Web services and XML Web service clients, see <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=220304</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=220304</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: To create XML Web services and XML Web service clients, see <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=220304</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=220304</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to integrate a simple ASP.NET web service with <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to integrate a simple ASP.NET web service with <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: By integrating your web service with <token>secondref_acs</token>, you factor the features of authentication and authorization out of your code.
trans-unit.target: By integrating your web service with <token>secondref_acs</token>, you factor the features of authentication and authorization out of your code.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> provides the mechanism for authenticating and authorizing clients to your web service.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> provides the mechanism for authenticating and authorizing clients to your web service.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="322264ea-cb30-4403-860c-97d6cdfa9a67" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Web Services and ACS</link>
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="322264ea-cb30-4403-860c-97d6cdfa9a67" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Web Services and ACS</link>

trans-unit.source: In a web service scenario, it is assumed that a web service client does not have access to a browser and is acting autonomously (without user participation).
trans-unit.target: In a web service scenario, it is assumed that a web service client does not have access to a browser and is acting autonomously (without user participation).

trans-unit.source: Also, in a web service scenario, a client can gain access to a web service using either a service identity or an enterprise identity.
trans-unit.target: Also, in a web service scenario, a client can gain access to a web service using either a service identity or an enterprise identity.

trans-unit.source: In the exercise described in this topic, a client gains access to a sample ASP.NET web service using a service identity credential type configured in <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: In the exercise described in this topic, a client gains access to a sample ASP.NET web service using a service identity credential type configured in <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: In order to perform the steps in this topic, you must download a sample ASP.NET service.
trans-unit.target: In order to perform the steps in this topic, you must download a sample ASP.NET service.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="42880f19-38c3-471a-9677-46012f4a23fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Code Sample: ASP.NET Web Service</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="42880f19-38c3-471a-9677-46012f4a23fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Code Sample: ASP.NET Web Service</link>.

trans-unit.source: HYPERLINK "http://acs.codeplex.com/"
trans-unit.target: HYPERLINK "http://acs.codeplex.com/"

trans-unit.source: Steps for Integrating ACS with an ASP.NET Web Service
trans-unit.target: Steps for Integrating ACS with an ASP.NET Web Service

trans-unit.source: Before performing the following steps, make sure that your system meets all of the .NET framework and platform requirements that are summarized in <link xlink:href="b52e98da-25cc-47d0-832f-a3ee58951524" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Prerequisites</link>.
trans-unit.target: Before performing the following steps, make sure that your system meets all of the .NET framework and platform requirements that are summarized in <link xlink:href="b52e98da-25cc-47d0-832f-a3ee58951524" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">ACS Prerequisites</link>.

trans-unit.source: To integrate <token>secondref_acs</token> with this sample ASP.NET web service, complete the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To integrate <token>secondref_acs</token> with this sample ASP.NET web service, complete the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Step 1 - Create an Access Control Namespace
trans-unit.target: Step 1 - Create an Access Control Namespace

trans-unit.source: For detailed instructions, see <link xlink:href="dba0b42b-c631-4f60-bb3a-7b84d2ac406f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Create an Access Control Namespace</link>.
trans-unit.target: For detailed instructions, see <link xlink:href="dba0b42b-c631-4f60-bb3a-7b84d2ac406f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Create an Access Control Namespace</link>.

trans-unit.source: Step 2 – Launch the ACS Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Step 2 – Launch the ACS Management Portal

trans-unit.source: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal allows you to configure your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> by adding identity providers, configuring relying party applications, defining rules and groups of rules, and establishing the credentials that your relying party application trusts.
trans-unit.target: The <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal allows you to configure your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> by adding identity providers, configuring relying party applications, defining rules and groups of rules, and establishing the credentials that your relying party application trusts.

trans-unit.source: To launch the ACS Management Portal
trans-unit.target: To launch the ACS Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Step 3 – Add a Relying Party Application
trans-unit.target: Step 3 – Add a Relying Party Application

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to add a relying party application.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to add a relying party application.

trans-unit.source: For more information about relying party applications, see <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about relying party applications, see <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.

trans-unit.source: To set up a relying party application
trans-unit.target: To set up a relying party application

trans-unit.source: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Relying Party Applications</ui> in the tree on the left-hand side or click the <ui>Relying Party Applications</ui> link under the <ui>Getting Started</ui> section.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Relying Party Applications</ui> in the tree on the left-hand side or click the <ui>Relying Party Applications</ui> link under the <ui>Getting Started</ui> section.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Relying Party Applications</ui> page, click <ui>Add</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Relying Party Applications</ui> page, click <ui>Add</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Add Relying Party Application</ui> page, do the following:
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Add Relying Party Application</ui> page, do the following:

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Name</ui>, type the name of the relying party application.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Name</ui>, type the name of the relying party application.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, type <userInput>ASPNET Simple Service</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, type <userInput>ASPNET Simple Service</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Mode</ui>, select <ui>Enter settings manually</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Mode</ui>, select <ui>Enter settings manually</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Realm</ui>, type the URI that the security token issued by <token>secondref_acs</token> applies to.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Realm</ui>, type the URI that the security token issued by <token>secondref_acs</token> applies to.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, type <userInput>http://localhost:8000/Service</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, type <userInput>http://localhost:8000/Service</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Return URL</ui>, type the URL that <token>secondref_acs</token> returns the security token to.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Return URL</ui>, type the URL that <token>secondref_acs</token> returns the security token to.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, type <userInput>http://localhost:8000/Service</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, type <userInput>http://localhost:8000/Service</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: In <ui> Error URL (optional)</ui>, enter the URL that <token>secondref_acs</token> can post to if an error occurs during sign in.
trans-unit.target: In <ui> Error URL (optional)</ui>, enter the URL that <token>secondref_acs</token> can post to if an error occurs during sign in.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, leave this field blank.
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, leave this field blank.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Token format</ui>, select a token format for <token>secondref_acs</token> to use when issuing security tokens to this relying party application.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Token format</ui>, select a token format for <token>secondref_acs</token> to use when issuing security tokens to this relying party application.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, select <ui>SWT</ui>.
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, select <ui>SWT</ui>.

trans-unit.source: For more information about tokens and token formats, see <link xlink:href="5fd7e09f-0c5b-4571-943e-c743ee0bac9d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Token Formats Supported in ACS </link> and “Token Format” in <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about tokens and token formats, see <link xlink:href="5fd7e09f-0c5b-4571-943e-c743ee0bac9d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Token Formats Supported in ACS </link> and “Token Format” in <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Token lifetime (secs)</ui>, specify the amount of time for a security token issued by ACS to remain valid.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Token lifetime (secs)</ui>, specify the amount of time for a security token issued by ACS to remain valid.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, accept the default value of <ui>600</ui>.
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, accept the default value of <ui>600</ui>.

trans-unit.source: For more information about token lifetimes, see “Token Encryption Policy” in <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about token lifetimes, see “Token Encryption Policy” in <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Identity providers</ui>, you can select the identity providers to use with this relying party application.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Identity providers</ui>, you can select the identity providers to use with this relying party application.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, however, no identity providers are used, the client gains access to the web service with a service identity, so make sure to clear the check box next to <ui><token>windows_live_id</token></ui>.
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, however, no identity providers are used, the client gains access to the web service with a service identity, so make sure to clear the check box next to <ui><token>windows_live_id</token></ui>.

trans-unit.source: For more information about service identities, see <link xlink:href="52225343-ab35-4455-b3f9-e014d7ac6b78" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Identities</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about service identities, see <link xlink:href="52225343-ab35-4455-b3f9-e014d7ac6b78" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Identities</link>.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Rule groups</ui>, select the rule groups for this relying party application to use when processing claims.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Rule groups</ui>, select the rule groups for this relying party application to use when processing claims.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, accept <ui>Create New Rule Group</ui> that is checked by default.
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, accept <ui>Create New Rule Group</ui> that is checked by default.

trans-unit.source: For more information about rule groups, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about rule groups, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.

trans-unit.source: Under <ui>Token Signing Settings</ui>, in <ui>Token signing key</ui>, click the <ui>Generate</ui> button to generate a 256-bit symmetric key for this relying party.
trans-unit.target: Under <ui>Token Signing Settings</ui>, in <ui>Token signing key</ui>, click the <ui>Generate</ui> button to generate a 256-bit symmetric key for this relying party.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Step 4 - Create Rules
trans-unit.target: Step 4 - Create Rules

trans-unit.source: Rules determine how claims are passed from identity providers or <token>secondref_acs</token> (if <token>secondref_acs</token> is the claims issuer) to your relying party application.
trans-unit.target: Rules determine how claims are passed from identity providers or <token>secondref_acs</token> (if <token>secondref_acs</token> is the claims issuer) to your relying party application.

trans-unit.source: For more information about rules and rule groups, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about rules and rule groups, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.

trans-unit.source: To create rules
trans-unit.target: To create rules

trans-unit.source: On the <ui><token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal Home</ui> page, click <ui>Rule Groups</ui> in the tree on the left-hand side or click <ui>Rule Groups</ui> link under the <ui>Getting Started</ui> section.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui><token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal Home</ui> page, click <ui>Rule Groups</ui> in the tree on the left-hand side or click <ui>Rule Groups</ui> link under the <ui>Getting Started</ui> section.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Rule Groups</ui> page, click <ui>Default Rule Group for ASPNET Simple Service</ui> (since you named your relying party application <userInput>ASPNET Simple Service</userInput>).
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Rule Groups</ui> page, click <ui>Default Rule Group for ASPNET Simple Service</ui> (since you named your relying party application <userInput>ASPNET Simple Service</userInput>).

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Edit Rule Group</ui> page, click <ui>Add</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Edit Rule Group</ui> page, click <ui>Add</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Add Claim Rule</ui> page, do the following:
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Add Claim Rule</ui> page, do the following:

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>If</ui> section, under <ui>Claim issuer</ui>, select <ui>Access Control Service</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>If</ui> section, under <ui>Claim issuer</ui>, select <ui>Access Control Service</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>If</ui> section, under <ui>Input claim type</ui>, leave the default selection of <ui>Any</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>If</ui> section, under <ui>Input claim type</ui>, leave the default selection of <ui>Any</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>If</ui> section, under <ui>Input claim value</ui>, leave the default selection of <ui>Any</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>If</ui> section, under <ui>Input claim value</ui>, leave the default selection of <ui>Any</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Then</ui> section, under <ui>Output claim type</ui>, select <ui>Enter type</ui> and then type <userInput>action</userInput>, because that is the claim type that is specified in the code of the ASP.NET web service sample that you are using in this exercise: <codeInline>requiredClaimType = “action”</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Then</ui> section, under <ui>Output claim type</ui>, select <ui>Enter type</ui> and then type <userInput>action</userInput>, because that is the claim type that is specified in the code of the ASP.NET web service sample that you are using in this exercise: <codeInline>requiredClaimType = “action”</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: You can find this string in the sample code, in Default.aspx.cs, under acs\WebServices\ASPNETSimpleService\Service.
trans-unit.target: You can find this string in the sample code, in Default.aspx.cs, under acs\WebServices\ASPNETSimpleService\Service.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Then</ui> section, under <ui>Output claim value</ui>, select <ui>Enter value</ui> and then type <userInput>reverse</userInput>, because that is the claim type that is specified in the code of the ASP.NET web service sample that you are using in this exercise: <codeInline>requiredClaimValue = “reverse”</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Then</ui> section, under <ui>Output claim value</ui>, select <ui>Enter value</ui> and then type <userInput>reverse</userInput>, because that is the claim type that is specified in the code of the ASP.NET web service sample that you are using in this exercise: <codeInline>requiredClaimValue = “reverse”</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: You can find this string in the sample code, in Default.aspx.cs, under acs\WebServices\ASPNETSimpleService\Service.
trans-unit.target: You can find this string in the sample code, in Default.aspx.cs, under acs\WebServices\ASPNETSimpleService\Service.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Edit Rule Group</ui> page, click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Edit Rule Group</ui> page, click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Step 5 – Configure a Service Identity
trans-unit.target: Step 5 – Configure a Service Identity

trans-unit.source: In the exercise described in this topic, the client requests an <token>secondref_acs</token>-issued Simple Web Token (SWT) from <token>secondref_acs</token> with a username and password registered with and managed by <token>secondref_acs</token>, in other words, an <token>secondref_acs</token> service identity.
trans-unit.target: In the exercise described in this topic, the client requests an <token>secondref_acs</token>-issued Simple Web Token (SWT) from <token>secondref_acs</token> with a username and password registered with and managed by <token>secondref_acs</token>, in other words, an <token>secondref_acs</token> service identity.

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to configure an <token>secondref_acs</token> service identity, or how to configure credentials hosted by <token>secondref_acs</token> that the client can use to request a token from <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to configure an <token>secondref_acs</token> service identity, or how to configure credentials hosted by <token>secondref_acs</token> that the client can use to request a token from <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="52225343-ab35-4455-b3f9-e014d7ac6b78" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Identities</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="52225343-ab35-4455-b3f9-e014d7ac6b78" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Identities</link>.

trans-unit.source: For this exercise, set the service identity name to <userInput>acssample</userInput> (the ASP.NET service client uses this value as a username when requesting a token from <token>secondref_acs</token>) and the password to <userInput>pass@word1</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this exercise, set the service identity name to <userInput>acssample</userInput> (the ASP.NET service client uses this value as a username when requesting a token from <token>secondref_acs</token>) and the password to <userInput>pass@word1</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: To configure a service identity
trans-unit.target: To configure a service identity

trans-unit.source: On the <ui><token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal Home</ui> page, click <ui>Service Identities</ui> in the tree on the left-hand side.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui><token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal Home</ui> page, click <ui>Service Identities</ui> in the tree on the left-hand side.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Service Identities</ui> page, click <ui>Add</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Service Identities</ui> page, click <ui>Add</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Add Service Identity</ui> page, do the following and then click <ui>Save</ui>:
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Add Service Identity</ui> page, do the following and then click <ui>Save</ui>:

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Name</ui>, type <userInput>acssample</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Name</ui>, type <userInput>acssample</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Type</ui>, select <ui>Password</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Type</ui>, select <ui>Password</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Password</ui>, type <userInput>pass@word1</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Password</ui>, type <userInput>pass@word1</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Leave the default values unchanged in <ui>Effective date</ui> and <ui>Expiration date</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Leave the default values unchanged in <ui>Effective date</ui> and <ui>Expiration date</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Edit Service Identity</ui> page, click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Edit Service Identity</ui> page, click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Step 6 – Configure Trust Between ACS and Your ASP.NET Web Service
trans-unit.target: Step 6 – Configure Trust Between ACS and Your ASP.NET Web Service

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to integrate <token>secondref_acs</token> with your sample ASP.NET service.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to integrate <token>secondref_acs</token> with your sample ASP.NET service.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="42880f19-38c3-471a-9677-46012f4a23fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Code Sample: ASP.NET Web Service</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="42880f19-38c3-471a-9677-46012f4a23fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Code Sample: ASP.NET Web Service</link>.

trans-unit.source: To configure trust between ACS and the ASP.NET web service
trans-unit.target: To configure trust between ACS and the ASP.NET web service

trans-unit.source: Locate <userInput>ASPNETSimpleService.sln</userInput> in the sample you downloaded and open it in Visual Studio® 2010.
trans-unit.target: Locate <userInput>ASPNETSimpleService.sln</userInput> in the sample you downloaded and open it in Visual Studio® 2010.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio 2010, in <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, under <ui>Solution ‘ASPNETSimpleService’</ui>, double-click <ui>web.config</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio 2010, in <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, under <ui>Solution ‘ASPNETSimpleService’</ui>, double-click <ui>web.config</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>web.config</embeddedLabel>, enter the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> name and the token signing key that you configured in <token>secondref_acs</token> in the previous steps above.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>web.config</embeddedLabel>, enter the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> name and the token signing key that you configured in <token>secondref_acs</token> in the previous steps above.

trans-unit.source: To view the token signing key, click <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui> in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: To view the token signing key, click <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui> in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: The following code snippet shows the elements of the <embeddedLabel>web.config</embeddedLabel> file that you need to update.
trans-unit.target: The following code snippet shows the elements of the <embeddedLabel>web.config</embeddedLabel> file that you need to update.

trans-unit.source: Save the updated <embeddedLabel>web.config</embeddedLabel> file.
trans-unit.target: Save the updated <embeddedLabel>web.config</embeddedLabel> file.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio 2010, in <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, under <ui>Solution ‘ASPNETSimpleService’</ui>, double-click the app.config file.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio 2010, in <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, under <ui>Solution ‘ASPNETSimpleService’</ui>, double-click the app.config file.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>app.config</embeddedLabel> file, enter the name of your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> and the username and password of the service identity that you configured in <token>secondref_acs</token> in the previous steps.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>app.config</embeddedLabel> file, enter the name of your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> and the username and password of the service identity that you configured in <token>secondref_acs</token> in the previous steps.

trans-unit.source: To view the username and the password, click <ui>Service Identities</ui> in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: To view the username and the password, click <ui>Service Identities</ui> in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: The following code snippet show the elements of the <embeddedLabel>app.config</embeddedLabel> file that you need to change.
trans-unit.target: The following code snippet show the elements of the <embeddedLabel>app.config</embeddedLabel> file that you need to change.

trans-unit.source: Save the updated <embeddedLabel>app.config</embeddedLabel> file.
trans-unit.target: Save the updated <embeddedLabel>app.config</embeddedLabel> file.

trans-unit.source: Step 7 – Test the Integration Between ACS and Your ASP.NET Web Service
trans-unit.target: Step 7 – Test the Integration Between ACS and Your ASP.NET Web Service

trans-unit.source: This section describes how you can test the integration between your ASP.NET web service and <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how you can test the integration between your ASP.NET web service and <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: To test the integration between ACS and your ASP.NET web service
trans-unit.target: To test the integration between ACS and your ASP.NET web service

trans-unit.source: To run the ASP.NET service, in Visual Studio 2010, press F5.
trans-unit.target: To run the ASP.NET service, in Visual Studio 2010, press F5.

trans-unit.source: To run the ASP.NET web service client, right-click <ui>Client</ui> in the Solution Explorer, then <ui>Debug</ui>, and then select <ui>Start New Instance</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To run the ASP.NET web service client, right-click <ui>Client</ui> in the Solution Explorer, then <ui>Debug</ui>, and then select <ui>Start New Instance</ui>.

trans-unit.source: A command line window opens with the following message in it: <userInput>Enter a string to reverse, then press <ENTER></userInput>.
trans-unit.target: A command line window opens with the following message in it: <userInput>Enter a string to reverse, then press <ENTER></userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Enter any string, for example, <userInput>hello world!</userInput>, and then press enter.
trans-unit.target: Enter any string, for example, <userInput>hello world!</userInput>, and then press enter.

trans-unit.source: If your input was <userInput>hello world!</userInput>, you should see the following response on the console application: <userInput>!dlrow olleh</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: If your input was <userInput>hello world!</userInput>, you should see the following response on the console application: <userInput>!dlrow olleh</userInput>.
